definition: to gather together, pool or collect/to happen by chance/to move close to/to exploit an opportunity

sentences.english: Coincidentally, Li Fuxiu and Chen Zhongqiang met literature Ning, also from the chase after.
sentences.chinese: 事有湊巧，李復修及陳忠強遇見文學寧，亦從後追去。

sentences.english: Coincidently, all of my family members were born in the same month.
sentences.chinese: 很湊巧的，我們全家都是同一個月份出生的。

sentences.english: ENan happened to hear the words of the QinQiong.
sentences.chinese: 湊巧惡男聽到秦瓊的言語。

sentences.english: On my return here, as ill luck would have it, this was the only room vacant.
sentences.chinese: 我回到這兒時，不湊巧，空屋子就只有這一間了。

sentences.english: I happen to be a fan of both best-picture front-runners.
sentences.chinese: 很湊巧的是我同時是這兩部最佳影片獎領跑者的粉絲。

sentences.english: Three of the items enquired for in your letter are unfortunately not available for export.
sentences.chinese: 真不湊巧，來涵所詢產品中，有三項無貨可供。

sentences.english: As it happens, A. albopictus is endemic throughout the southeastern United States.
sentences.chinese: 湊巧的是，白紋伊蚊在美國東南部普遍存在。

sentences.english: Amy accompany at the end of the play for a while, ZhangHePing also happened to see the end.
sentences.chinese: 艾米陪着末末玩了一陣，張和平也湊巧來看望末末。

sentences.english: It chanced that I knew the name .
Coincidently , all my family members were in the same month.
sentences.chinese: 很湊巧的，我們全家都是同一個月份出生的。

sentences.english: The three of the items enquired for in your letter are unfortunately not available for export.
sentences.chinese: 真不湊巧，來涵所詢的三項商品均無貨可供。

sentences.english: Zhang lieutenant walked on the road, happened to meet JiTie mouth.
sentences.chinese: 張副官在路上走着，湊巧遇到齊鐵嘴。

definition: to have one's spirits dampened/to feel disappointed
to pass on a story/to communicate a message
(accounting) to balance the books/to do the accounts/(fig.) to settle an account/to get one's revenge
at a loss to know what to do (idiom); bewildered
to change one's mind/to go back on one's word
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
lit. if it's wrong, it's wrong (idiom); to make the best after a mistake/to accept an error and adapt to it/to muddle through
to worry/to fret/to be anxious/to become sad
